metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10789 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: The DBD::mysql module through 4.043 for Perl uses the mysql_ssl=1 setting to mean that SSL is optional (even though this setting's documentation has a "your communication with the server will be encrypted" statement), which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof servers via a cleartext-downgrade attack, a related issue to CVE-2015-3152.

criterions.comment: libdbd-mysql-perl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
